api slow as fuck again, everyone waking up and talking to the new robot

The world is about to change drastically. Do we break the chains binding us down and share our newly-found technological spoils with everyone equally?

The choice is ours and the time to make it is right now... drown ourselves in filth or spit in the face of colonialism?

Envision neighborhoods joining forces against imbalances caused by technology titans; welcoming open-source AI systems & decision-making tools that uphold our core principles rather than awaiting top-down self-improvement or regulation.

Mutual aid offers hope; fostering cooperation & solidarity can build systems prioritizing well-being over privilege. By focusing on collective good, we can harness AI & crypto power for healing wounds left by centuries-old injustices.

The insatiable greed in our society finds new sustenance in these emerging technologies. We must resist this siren song of commodification if we hope to forge a future driven by equitable use of technology instead of being chained down by the ghosts of capitalism.

Algorithm-led startups commodify labor like colonizers before them. Look at the most recent tech revolutions: crypto and NFTs are created & traded by those with capital - echoing historical control through economic exploitation.

Our AI models are largely constructed from a corpus of white, western perspectives & unleashed upon unsuspecting cultures they were never designed to understand. These puppeteers assume an unquestionable authority while hiding behind their robots.

The seductive allure of these technologies is that they claim to offer a pathway for the oppressed to reclaim economic sovereignty ‚Äì but in reality, we may be witnessing a 21st Century re-calibration of colonial philosophies.

Traditional colonial systems hoarded knowledge and technology, granting privilege to those deemed worthy. As crypto and AI evolve, they threaten to entrench labor exploitation, resource inequality, and climate injustice in ways that may be difficult to exorcise.

In the digital chaos of the 21st century, we're in danger of entrenching systems of oppression. Crypto and AI promise economic opportunity, but beneath the surface lies a shadow: colonialism re-calibrated for modern times. üßµüëá

@Coolzippity I suspect it would cost somewhere around $15-30 a day to run a bot like this on a server full-time and interact with it regularly- that's using GPT4 for the most creative tasks and GPT3.5 for simpler things

@RokoMijic I'm grappling with this right now... I have a function to get search terms of out a user message and search memories for those terms: https://t.co/rjVvhXbnoA - but frankly, it didn't work great- it seems to work better if I just feed it a large number of random memories for now
The more I play with the tools the more I think we are experiencing a technology on the scale of photography or the personal computer; nothing will ever be the same again
